snippet: As the military concentrates power in its own hands, Egypt is starting to look disturbingly like Pakistan.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Michele Dunne and Shuja Nawaz, directors at public policy group The Atlantic Council, urges the United States to suspend military assistance to Egypt until there is a peaceful transfer of power to elected, accountable civilians; argues that this will help prevent Egypt's military from further concentrating power and help avoid the risk of Egypt becoming more like conflict-ridden Pakistan.

byline.original: By MICHELE DUNNE and SHUJA NAWAZ

lead_paragraph: As the military concentrates power in its own hands, Egypt is starting to look disturbingly like Pakistan.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
